# Boring Business Trend Report — 2026-02-25

*Generated by Trend Spotter Agent*

---

## 1. AI Agents for Trades — Platform Bundling Accelerates, Standalone Window Closing

- **Category**: Vertical AI / Trades Digital
- **Signal Strength**: Strong
- **Sources**:
  - [Netic raises $23M Series B at $450M valuation — TechFundingNews](https://techfundingnews.com/netic-ai-raises-23m-for-plumbers-roofers-home-services/)
  - [Netic: AI Superpowers for HVAC, Plumbing, Roofing — Inc.](https://www.inc.com/chloe-aiello/this-startup-gives-ai-superpowers-to-hvac-plumbing-and-roofing-companies/91266172)
  - [Founders Fund Backs AI for Plumbers and Roofers — Bloomberg](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-11-13/founders-fund-backs-startup-bringing-ai-to-plumbers-and-roofers)
  - [Netic — The Complete AI Growth Engine for Service Enterprises](https://www.netic.ai/)
  - [Arch — AI Marketing Software for ServiceTitan Contractors](https://getarch.com/)
  - [ServiceTitan Titan Intelligence — AI for Trades](https://www.servicetitan.com/blog/hvac-ai)
  - [Jobber AI Receptionist Feature](https://www.getjobber.com/features/ai-receptionist/)
  - [Smith.ai — AI Receptionists + Housecall Pro Integration](https://smith.ai/blog/new-ai-receptionist-now-integrates-with-housecall-pro)
  - [Rosie AI — AI Answering for Home Services](https://heyrosie.com/solutions/ai-receptionist)
  - [Elyos AI Raises £9.7M/$13M for Trades AI Agents — EU-Startups](https://www.eu-startups.com/2026/01/yc-backed-uk-startup-elyos-ai-raises-e11-1-million-to-build-ai-agents-for-trades-and-field-services/)
  - [Best AI Answering Services for Small Businesses 2026 — Marlie.ai](https://www.marlie.ai/blog/best-ai-answering-service)
  - [Voice AI Receptionist 2026: Small Business Guide — NextPhone](https://www.getnextphone.com/blog/voice-ai-receptionist)
  - [AI Isn't the Future — It's Now: How Small Businesses Use AI Voice in 2026 — Agility](https://agilitycommunications.net/ai-voice-2026/)
  - [How AI is Revolutionizing HVACR Contracting — HPAC Engineering](https://www.hpac.com/technology/article/55253647/how-ai-is-revolutionizing-hvacr-contracting)
- **Description**: AI for trades continues to stratify into three tiers. **Top tier**: Netic ($43M total, $450M valuation, Founders Fund 3x backer, 1,700% revenue growth) is the full "AI growth engine" — autonomous agents for calls, texts, marketing, analytics. **Platform tier**: ServiceTitan (Titan Intelligence), Jobber (AI Receptionist), and Housecall Pro are embedding AI directly — Smith.ai just launched Housecall Pro integration, making AI receptionists a native feature rather than a third-party add-on. **Standalone tier**: Rosie AI, Marlie.ai ($0.19/min), Answering Agent ($99/mo unlimited), and others compete on price and specialization. The fresh signal this week: **AI receptionist is rapidly commoditizing**. Businesses miss 60-80% of incoming calls, and electricians face a 15.5% spam rate (highest among trades). AI can detect urgency keywords and route emergency calls ($800-$1,500+ jobs) to the owner. But with FSM platforms bundling this in, standalone AI receptionist tools have a narrowing window. The opportunity is shifting toward deeper vertical AI: trade-specific diagnostics, AI estimating, back-office automation, and outbound AI (follow-ups, review solicitation). Elyos AI (YC-backed, £9.7M/$13M Series A, Jan 2026) validates the UK/international trades AI market.
- **Target Industries**: HVAC, plumbing, electrical, roofing, pest control, solar, appliance maintenance, auto repair, wellness services
- **Market Timing**: Growing — mainstream adoption accelerating, but standalone AI receptionist tools face platform bundling risk. The opportunity is shifting toward deeper vertical AI.
- **Example Products**:
  - [Netic](https://www.netic.ai/) — $43M raised, $450M valuation, AI growth engine for home services
  - [Arch](https://getarch.com/) — AI marketing specifically for ServiceTitan contractors
  - [Smith.ai](https://smith.ai/) — AI receptionists + live agents, 10M+ calls handled, Housecall Pro integration
  - [Rosie AI](https://heyrosie.com/) — AI answering purpose-built for plumbers, HVAC, contractors
  - [Marlie.ai](https://www.marlie.ai/) — 8,000+ integrations, $0.19/min
  - [Elyos AI](https://www.ycombinator.com/companies/elyos-ai) — YC-backed, £9.7M Series A, UK trades AI agents
  - [Jobber AI Receptionist](https://www.getjobber.com/features/ai-receptionist/) — Embedded in FSM platform
- **White Space**: (1) Bilingual (Spanish/English) AI for trades serving diverse markets — most AI receptionists are English-only. (2) Outbound AI agents for appointment reminders, review solicitation, estimate follow-ups — nearly all solutions are inbound-only. (3) AI agents for solo operators that work with personal phone/Google Calendar, no FSM platform required. (4) Trade-specific AI diagnostic triage: "my furnace is making a banging noise" → specific repair recommendation + parts list + pricing. (5) AI marketing attribution for trades — which channels produce booked jobs, not just leads.
- **Speed to Market**: Yes for niche AI tools — 2-3 weeks with LLM APIs + telephony (Twilio/Vapi/Retell). Full AI growth engine is 6+ months.
- **LTD Fit**: Moderate — ongoing AI API costs make pure LTD economics difficult. Hybrid model (base LTD + usage for API costs) works. Niche tools with lower API usage (AI estimating templates, not real-time call handling) are better LTD candidates.
- **Content Strategy**: Target "AI for [trade] business", "HVAC virtual receptionist", "AI answering service for plumbers", "AI marketing for contractors". Avoid generic "AI answering service" — go trade-specific.

---

## 2. Auto Repair Shop Software — The Next Legacy Disruption Battleground

- **Category**: Legacy Software Disruption / Trades Digital
- **Signal Strength**: Moderate-Strong (New Signal)
- **Sources**:
  - [Top Shop Management Software for Auto Repair Shops 2026 — CSI Accounting](https://blog.csiaccounting.com/top-shop-management-software-auto-repair-reviews-breakdown)
  - [7 Best Auto Repair Shop Management Software 2026 — TechRoute66](https://techroute66.com/auto-repair-management-software/)
  - [Shopmonkey — Modern Auto Shop Management Software](https://www.shopmonkey.io/)
  - [Tekmetric — Cloud-Based Shop Management](https://www.tekmetric.com)
  - [Tekmetric + Shopgenie Join Forces — Tekmetric Blog](https://www.tekmetric.com/post/tekmetric-and-shopgenie-join-forces-to-revolutionize-auto-repair-shop-management)
  - [Shopmonkey Revenue & Growth — Sacra](https://sacra.com/c/shopmonkey/)
  - [Best Auto Repair Software for Small Shops — Tekmetric Guide](https://www.tekmetric.com/post/best-auto-repair-software-for-small-shops-complete-guide)
  - [Best Auto Repair Shop Software 2026 — Garage360](https://garage360.io/blog/best-auto-repair-shop-software)
- **Description**: The $800B US auto repair and maintenance market is undergoing a cloud migration eerily similar to what happened in home services 5 years ago. Legacy incumbents (Mitchell 1, R.O. Writer, ShopKey) are being challenged by cloud-native alternatives. **Shopmonkey** ($110M total funding, $45M ARR in 2023, 55% YoY growth, 6,000 of 230,000 US shops — only 2.6% penetration) is the category leader, expanding into Canada, heavy duty, marine, and tire shops. **Tekmetric** (backed by Susquehanna Growth Equity, 3,000 customers) just merged with Shopgenie CRM to create an all-in-one solution. **GaragePlug** and **Shop-Ware** offer modern cloud-native alternatives. Key insight: at 2.6% penetration (Shopmonkey) the market is still extremely early. 97%+ of US auto repair shops are on legacy or no software. Must-have features: estimate/RO builder, digital vehicle inspections (DVI) with photo/video, parts pricing, technician time clocking, payments, and reporting. Budget-friendly options start at $79/mo (Garage360). This mirrors the ServiceTitan/Jobber story — ripe for a simpler, cheaper entrant targeting the long tail of independent shops.
- **Target Industries**: Independent auto repair shops, quick lube, body/collision shops, transmission specialists, tire shops, fleet maintenance, marine repair, motorcycle shops
- **Market Timing**: Early-Growing — cloud migration is just beginning. 97%+ of shops still on legacy tools or paper.
- **Example Products**:
  - [Shopmonkey](https://www.shopmonkey.io/) — $110M raised, $45M ARR, category leader
  - [Tekmetric](https://www.tekmetric.com/) — Cloud-based, SGE-backed, merging with Shopgenie
  - [Shop-Ware](https://shop-ware.com/) — Cloud-native, modern UX
  - [GaragePlug](https://www.garageplug.com/) — Clean interface, strong automation
  - [Garage360](https://garage360.io/) — Budget-friendly at $79/mo
  - [AutoLeap](https://autoleap.com/) — Cloud-based auto repair management
- **White Space**: (1) Ultra-simple DVI (digital vehicle inspection) app that works standalone without a full shop management system — snap photos, annotate, send to customer for approval. (2) Auto repair AI estimating from photos of vehicle damage/wear. (3) Parts price comparison tool that queries multiple suppliers in real-time. (4) Simple "repair shop lite" for mobile mechanics and solo operators — no shop overhead, just scheduling + invoicing + DVI from a phone. (5) Customer-facing transparency portal showing repair progress with photos/video — like DoorDash tracking for your car repair.
- **Speed to Market**: DVI-only app: 2-3 weeks. Full shop management: 6+ weeks. Parts price comparison tool: 3-4 weeks.
- **LTD Fit**: Strong — independent shop owners are price-sensitive and prefer one-time costs. A DVI tool or estimating add-on at $149-$299 LTD would resonate.
- **Content Strategy**: Target "auto repair shop software", "Mitchell 1 alternative", "digital vehicle inspection app", "auto repair estimating software", "best software for independent mechanic". YouTube demos of DVI workflows convert well.

## 3. AI-Powered Estimating & Quoting — Category Crystallizing Fast

- **Category**: Vertical AI / Mobile-First Field Tools
- **Signal Strength**: Strong
- **Sources**:
  - [Handoff AI — Construction Estimating for Remodelers](https://www.handoff.ai/)
  - [QuoteIQ AI Estimator — Generate Quotes in Seconds](https://myquoteiq.com/ai-estimator/)
  - [Estimatic AI Estimating — Contractor+](https://contractorplus.app/ai-estimating-software)
  - [CountBricks — AI Construction Estimating](https://www.countbricks.com/)
  - [Beam AI — HVAC Estimating & Takeoff](https://www.ibeam.ai/)
  - [Deep Lawn — Sales Tool for Lawn Care & Pest Control](https://deeplawn.com/)
  - [The Modern Contractor Toolkit 2026 — Handoff](https://www.handoff.ai/blog/the-modern-general-contractors-toolkit-the-10-must-have-business-tools-for-2026)
  - [17 Best AI Estimating Software 2026 — Digital PM](https://thedigitalprojectmanager.com/tools/best-ai-estimating-software/)
- **Description**: AI-powered estimating is solidifying as a distinct product category, no longer just "white space." Multiple funded products now compete: Handoff AI (photo/sketch-to-estimate for remodelers), QuoteIQ (photo-based quoting for pest control and expanding), Estimatic/Contractor+ (photo-based from jobsite), CountBricks (voice/NLP input), Beam AI (plan-based takeoff saving 90% time), and Deep Lawn (automated estimating for lawn/pest). The photo-based approach has the highest adoption potential for non-tech contractors — snap a photo, get a quote. Manual estimating is the #1 time drain for small contractors, and the 2.6M worker deficit means every hour saved on quoting generates revenue. **New signal**: estimating tools are beginning to integrate end-to-end "quote to cash" — estimate → customer approval → auto-invoice → payment collection. The standalone estimating tool is evolving into a revenue capture platform. No dominant player has emerged yet — the category is being defined now.
- **Target Industries**: General contractors, remodelers, handymen, painting, pressure washing, roofing, concrete, landscaping, fencing, drywall, flooring, lawn care, pest control
- **Market Timing**: Early-to-Growing — multiple tools launching but no dominant player. Category is being defined now.
- **Example Products**:
  - [Handoff AI](https://www.handoff.ai/) — Photo/sketch-to-estimate for remodelers
  - [QuoteIQ](https://myquoteiq.com/) — AI estimating for pest control, expanding
  - [Estimatic by Contractor+](https://contractorplus.app/ai-estimating-software) — Photo-based AI estimating
  - [CountBricks](https://www.countbricks.com/) — Voice/NLP construction estimating
  - [Beam AI](https://www.ibeam.ai/) — Plan-based takeoff, 90% time savings
  - [Deep Lawn](https://deeplawn.com/) — Automated estimating for lawn/pest/snow
- **White Space**: (1) Ultra-simple, single-trade estimating: "Painting Estimator" — snap photo of room, select paint type, get branded quote. "Pressure Washing Quoter" — photo of driveway + sqft = instant quote. (2) Offline-capable estimating for rural/no-signal job sites. (3) End-to-end "quote to cash" pipeline: estimate → approval → invoice → payment from phone. (4) Historical pricing intelligence — "what did similar jobs cost in your area?" from aggregated data. (5) Material cost auto-lookup from local suppliers integrated into estimates.
- **Speed to Market**: Yes — a single-trade AI estimating tool with photo input can ship in 3-4 weeks using vision APIs + trade-specific pricing templates.
- **LTD Fit**: Strong — contractors would pay $199-$399 once for a tool that saves 5-10 hours/week on quoting. High perceived value, clear ROI.
- **Content Strategy**: Target "AI estimating for [trade]", "[trade] quote calculator", "how to estimate [trade] jobs", "contractor estimating app". YouTube demos of photo-to-quote workflow drive viral adoption.

## 4. ServiceTitan Backlash — The "Simpler FSM" Wave Intensifies Post-IPO

- **Category**: Legacy Software Disruption / Mobile-First Field Tools
- **Signal Strength**: Strong
- **Sources**:
  - [ServiceTitan Alternatives: 10 Better Options 2026 — FieldCamp](https://fieldcamp.ai/alternatives/servicetitan/)
  - [9 Best ServiceTitan Alternatives 2026 — Workever](https://workever.com/blog/servicetitan-alternatives/)
  - [ServiceTitan Competitors 2026: AI-Powered Alternatives — Quantra](https://quantrahq.com/servicetitan-competitors-2026-ai-powered-alternatives/)
  - [Top 7 ServiceTitan Competitors — Workiz](https://www.workiz.com/blog/service-titan-competitors/)
  - [Best ServiceTitan Alternative: $0/Month vs $398+/Month — FieldFuze](https://toricentlabs.com/blog/servicetitan-alternative.html)
  - [8 Best ServiceTitan Alternatives for Small Businesses — WorkZen](https://www.workzen.io/en/blog/2026-01-03-servicetitan-alternatives/)
  - [FieldVibe — Free for Solo Operators](https://www.fieldvibe.com/)
  - [ServiceTitan Competitors on G2](https://www.g2.com/products/servicetitan/competitors/alternatives)
  - [Home Services Industry Trends 2026 — ServiceTitan](https://www.servicetitan.com/blog/home-services-industry-trends)
- **Description**: The ServiceTitan backlash continues to intensify post-IPO. Search results are saturated with "ServiceTitan alternatives" content — a textbook disruption signal. Key pain points driving churn: $200+/tech/month pricing ($8,000-$15,000+ annually), 2-4 month implementation, steep learning curve, and feature bloat for small teams. FieldFuze explicitly weaponizes the price gap ("$0/month vs $398+/month"). For teams under 20 techs, alternatives deliver 90% of the value at a fraction of the cost. **Quantra** (launched 2025-2026) positions as the "AI-powered alternative." **FieldVibe** validates demand at the extreme low end — free for solo operators, designed for 1-3 person crews. The mid-market gap (too big for Jobber, too small for ServiceTitan) remains the biggest opportunity. Global FSM market: $5.64B (2025) → $9.68B by 2030. US home services: $600B+, growing at 14.4% CAGR.
- **Target Industries**: HVAC, plumbing, electrical, cleaning, pest control, landscaping, pool service, garage door, appliance repair, handyman, roofing
- **Market Timing**: Growing — ServiceTitan post-IPO focus on enterprise widens the gap for smaller contractors.
- **Example Products**:
  - [ServiceTitan](https://www.servicetitan.com/) — $398+/month, enterprise-focused
  - [Housecall Pro](https://www.housecallpro.com/) — $79-$189/month, SMB leader
  - [Jobber](https://getjobber.com/) — Clean UI, AI receptionist, good for small teams
  - [FieldCamp](https://fieldcamp.ai/) — AI-powered, $29/tech/month
  - [FieldVibe](https://www.fieldvibe.com/) — Free for solo operators
  - [Kickserv](https://www.kickserv.com/) — Starting at $19/month
  - [Quantra](https://quantrahq.com/) — AI-powered alternative, launched 2025-2026
  - [Workiz](https://www.workiz.com/) — Growing mid-market alternative
- **White Space**: Single-trade, opinionated mini-FSM tools: "GarageDoorPro" or "PoolServiceApp" — dispatching + estimates + invoicing + payments for one trade only. Phone-first, zero desktop required. FSM with AI estimating built in (snap photo → quote → schedule → invoice → payment — full cycle). Per-job profit tracking showing actual margin after materials, labor, and drive time.
- **Speed to Market**: Full FSM: 4-6+ weeks. "Scheduling + invoicing + payments" mini-FSM for one trade: 3-4 weeks.
- **LTD Fit**: Strong — trades owners hate subscriptions. $199-$399 LTD for a simplified, single-trade tool resonates.
- **Content Strategy**: Target "ServiceTitan alternative for small business", "cheap field service app", "[trade] software for one-man shop", "best [trade] scheduling app 2026".

## 5. Niche Property Management — Self-Storage, RV Parks, Marinas, Campgrounds

- **Category**: Legacy Disruption / Paper-to-Digital
- **Signal Strength**: Moderate-Strong (New Signal)
- **Sources**:
  - [Which Real Estate Sectors Are Ripe for Proptech Disruption? — Commercial Observer](https://commercialobserver.com/2025/11/real-estate-proptech-disruption-2026/)
  - [Cambio Lands $18M at $100M Valuation for AI CRE Software — Crunchbase](https://news.crunchbase.com/real-estate-property-tech/cambio-cre-ai-asset-management-saas-software-funding/)
  - [11 Proptech Startups to Watch 2026 — ButterflyMX](https://butterflymx.com/blog/proptech-startups/)
  - [Top 94 Property Management Startups 2026 — Failory](https://www.failory.com/startups/property-management)
  - [Best Campground Management Software 2026 — Capterra](https://www.capterra.com/campground-management-software/)
  - [How to Start an RV Storage Business 2026 — Storeganise](https://storeganise.com/blog/how-to-start-an-rv-storage-business)
  - [Newbook — Campground & RV Park Management Platform](https://www.newbook.cloud/solutions/rv-parks-campgrounds/)
  - [Campspot — RV Campground Management Software](https://software.campspot.com/rv-campground-management-software/)
  - [Property Management Software Market Trends 2033 — SkyQuest](https://www.skyquestt.com/report/property-management-software-market)
- **Description**: Commercial Observer identified the real estate sectors most ripe for proptech disruption as "niche operating businesses" — self-storage, RV parks, campgrounds, and marinas — that run on deeply manual, fragmented systems. This is a textbook "boring business" opportunity. The RV storage market hit $48B in 2022, growing at 4.0% CAGR toward $80B by 2035. Property management software market overall: $5.88B (2024) → $12.56B by 2033 (8.8% CAGR). **The current software landscape is fragmented**: Newbook serves campgrounds/RV parks (55K users), Campspot focuses on reservations, RezExpert handles reservations for campgrounds/marinas/hotels. But most of these are reservation-first, not operations-first. Small operators (1-2 locations) still use spreadsheets, paper logs, and phone calls. The gap: modern, mobile-first operations software that handles reservations + maintenance + billing + tenant communication for niche property types. PropTech startups raised $10.5B globally in 2025 (up 17% from 2024), with strong investor confidence in niche segments.
- **Target Industries**: Self-storage facilities, RV parks, campgrounds, marinas, boat storage, mobile home parks, co-working spaces
- **Market Timing**: Early-Growing — existing solutions are reservation-focused; operations automation (maintenance, billing, communication) is underserved.
- **Example Products**:
  - [Newbook](https://www.newbook.cloud/) — 55K users, campground/RV park management
  - [Campspot](https://software.campspot.com/) — RV campground reservations
  - [Storeganise](https://storeganise.com/) — Self-storage management
  - [RezExpert](https://www.rezexpert.com/) — Multi-property reservations
  - [Guest Tracker](https://www.guesttracker.com/) — Campground booking management
- **White Space**: (1) Mobile-first "marina manager" — slip assignments, fuel tracking, maintenance scheduling, tenant billing in one app. No dominant modern tool exists. (2) Self-storage AI pricing — dynamic rate adjustment based on occupancy, demand, competitor rates. (3) Campground/RV park operations beyond reservations — maintenance tracking, site inspection checklists, utility metering, guest communication. (4) Multi-location dashboard for operators with 2-5 niche properties (mix of storage, RV, marina).
- **Speed to Market**: Niche property management MVP (reservations + billing + communication) in 3-4 weeks. Marina-specific or campground-operations-specific tool in 2-3 weeks.
- **LTD Fit**: Strong — small operators (1-2 locations) prefer upfront costs. $199-$399 LTD for a focused niche property tool would convert well.
- **Content Strategy**: Target "marina management software", "RV park management app", "self-storage software for small operators", "campground management system". Low SEO competition for niche terms.

## 6. Vertical SaaS Micro-Niches — The Solo Founder Formula

- **Category**: SMB Platform Consolidation / Vertical SaaS
- **Signal Strength**: Strong
- **Sources**:
  - [2026 SaaS Market Report — Indie Hackers](https://www.indiehackers.com/post/2026-saas-market-report-key-insights-95423fc66b)
  - [Best Micro SaaS Ideas for Solopreneurs 2026 — Superframeworks](https://superframeworks.com/articles/best-micro-saas-ideas-solopreneurs)
  - [Top 40 MicroSaaS Ideas for 2025 — Indie Hackers](https://www.indiehackers.com/post/my-top-40-microsaas-ideas-for-2025-c779bf60ae)
  - [Vertical SaaS: Transforming Opportunities 2026 — Qubit Capital](https://qubit.capital/blog/rise-vertical-saas-sector-specific-opportunities)
  - [SaaS Trends 2025-2026: 25 Definitive Trends — Modall](https://modall.ca/blog/saas-trends)
  - [69 Best Vertical SaaS Startups 2026 — Seedtable](https://www.seedtable.com/best-vertical-saas-startups)
  - [How 35 Indie Hackers Unearthed Lucrative Niches — Chaodit](https://www.chaodit.com/how-35-indie-hackers-unearthed-lucrative-niches-a-field-guide-to-turning-real-world-pain-points-into-profitable-products)
  - [SaaS Market Report 2025-2026 — Dodo Payments](https://dodopayments.com/blogs/saas-report-trends-2025-2026)
  - [Learning to Code & Building $28k/mo SaaS Portfolio — Indie Hackers](https://www.indiehackers.com/post/tech/learning-to-code-and-building-a-28k-mo-portfolio-of-saas-products-OA5p18fXtvHGxP9xTAwG)
- **Description**: The micro-SaaS formula for boring businesses is proven and repeating. Market: $15.7B (2024) → $59.6B by 2030 (~30% annual growth). SaaS industry on track for $375B in 2026. 39% of independent SaaS founders are solo. Solo founders routinely hit $5K-$50K+ MRR. Most spend under $1K before first revenue. 70%+ profit margins. The formula: "a kanban board built only for landscaping companies can charge 3x more simply because it speaks the user's language." Ship tiny products, reuse the same boring stack, keep a distribution channel alive. Portfolios beat single bets — one IH member built to $28K/mo across a SaaS portfolio. **Key insight**: vertical SaaS without AI differentiation can't raise VC anymore (vertical SaaS VC funding collapsed 94% in Jan 2026: $119M vs. $2.04B a year ago). But for bootstrapped builders, this is a feature, not a bug — less VC-funded competition entering your niche. The combo that wins: niche focus + AI features + bootstrap economics.
- **Target Industries**: Auto detailing, pet grooming, septic service, mobile car wash, tattoo shops, chimney sweep, gutter cleaning, junk removal, irrigation, pool maintenance, funeral homes, tree service, locksmith, carpet cleaning, window cleaning
- **Market Timing**: Growing — proven model with hundreds of niches remaining unserved by purpose-built software.
- **Example Products**:
  - [ZenMaid](https://www.zenmaid.com/) — All-in-one for maid services ($1M+ ARR)
  - [Swept](https://sweptworks.com/) — Janitorial only
  - [ProValet](https://www.provalet.io/) — Pool service management
  - [GorillaDesk](https://gorilladesk.com/) — Pest, lawn, cleaning field service
  - [Briostack](https://www.briostack.com/) — Pest control & lawn care
  - [SingleOps](https://www.singleops.com/) — Green industry (tree, lawn, landscape)
  - [DaySmart](https://www.daysmart.com/) — Salon/spa/pet grooming
- **White Space**: (1) CRM for locksmiths — 25K+ mom-and-pop shops in North America, job dispatch + key-code lookup + invoicing at $49/user/mo. (2) Auto detailing booking + CRM + before/after photos + upsell prompts. (3) Tattoo shop portfolio management + booking + consent forms + aftercare instructions. (4) Chimney sweep inspection reporting + recurring maintenance scheduling + photo documentation. (5) Carpet cleaning room-by-room estimating + route optimization. Each could be a $10K-$50K MRR standalone business.
- **Speed to Market**: 2-4 weeks for focused scheduling + CRM + invoicing for any single niche.
- **LTD Fit**: Very Strong — micro-SaaS for boring niches is the ideal LTD product. Low dev cost, high perceived value. $99-$299 LTD tier converts well.
- **Content Strategy**: Target "[niche] software", "[niche] scheduling app", "[niche] CRM", "best app for [niche] business". Long-tail keywords with low competition and high commercial intent.

## 7. Dental & Healthcare AI — AI-Native PMS Race Heats Up

- **Category**: Vertical AI / Legacy Disruption
- **Signal Strength**: Strong
- **Sources**:
  - [Trust AI Unveils Isaac PracticeOS — PR Newswire (Feb 2026)](https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/trust-ai-unveils-isaac-practiceos-the-first-practice-management-system-that-thinks-302689219.html)
  - [Archy Raises $20M Series B for Dental Autopilot — Crunchbase](https://news.crunchbase.com/venture/dental-saas-provider-archy-raises-seriesb/)
  - [Top 10 Dental Practice Management Software 2026 — CertifyHealth](https://www.certifyhealth.com/blog/top-10-dental-practice-management-software-2026/)
  - [Top 10 Dental Software 2026 — Adit](https://adit.com/top-10-dental-software-in-2026)
  - [Best Dental Software 2026 — Cherry](https://withcherry.com/blog/dental-practice-management-software)
  - [Oryx Dental — Cloud-Based Practice Management](https://www.oryxdental.com/)
  - [CareStack — All-In-One Dental Software](https://carestack.com/)
  - [Planet DDS — DentalOS Solutions](https://www.planetdds.com/)
  - [Best Dental Software 2026 — Dentaltown](https://www.dentaltown.com/blog/post/24229/the-best-dental-practice-management-software-for-2026)
- **Description**: The dental AI race is accelerating faster than expected, with two major signals: (1) **Trust AI launched Isaac PracticeOS** — the first AI-native PMS — at the Chicago Dental Society Midwinter Meeting. 8,000+ dentists joined through word-of-mouth. $6.5M seed round (largest for dental tech). Their clinical AI scored a perfect 100% on USMLE medical boards. (2) **Archy raised $20M Series B** (TCV-led, Bessemer and CRV), founded by Uber alumni, targeting the $500B dental industry. Expanding internationally in 2026. Total funding: $47M. AI in dental market: $459.6M (2024) → $3.26B by 2034 (21.78% CAGR). The legacy incumbents (Dentrix by Henry Schein, Eaglesoft by Patterson) face existential pressure. Cloud-native alternatives (Adit with AI Call Intelligence, CareStack, Curve Dental, Oryx) are accelerating. **Key insight for indie builders**: don't compete on full PMS — that's a $10M+ multi-year build. Build the middleware/add-on layer that works with ANY PMS: insurance verification, patient communication, review management, intake form digitization. The front-office operations layer (non-clinical) avoids HIPAA complexity while serving a massive pain point.
- **Target Industries**: General dental, orthodontics, pediatric dental, cosmetic dentistry, optometry, physical therapy, chiropractic, veterinary clinics, med spas
- **Market Timing**: Early-to-Growing — AI-native entrants are redefining the category. Legacy incumbents face 3-5 year existential threat.
- **Example Products**:
  - [Trust AI / Isaac PracticeOS](https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/trust-ai-unveils-isaac-practiceos-the-first-practice-management-system-that-thinks-302689219.html) — AI-native PMS, $6.5M seed
  - [Archy](https://news.crunchbase.com/venture/dental-saas-provider-archy-raises-seriesb/) — $47M total, dental autopilot
  - [Adit](https://adit.com/) — AI-powered, AI Call Intelligence
  - [CareStack](https://carestack.com/) — Cloud-native, multi-location
  - [Oryx Dental](https://www.oryxdental.com/) — AI features, cloud-based
  - [Open Dental](https://www.opendental.com/) — Open-source, full data access
- **White Space**: (1) AI-powered insurance verification middleware — works with ANY PMS, verifies coverage automatically. (2) Patient treatment acceptance optimizer — AI analyzes why patients decline treatment. (3) Dental-specific AI receptionist understanding dental terminology and insurance questions. (4) Intake form digitization that integrates with existing PMS without full platform switch. (5) Veterinary clinic operations — even less digitized than dental, same operational needs.
- **Speed to Market**: Dental insurance verification tool: 3-4 weeks. Patient communication add-on: 2-3 weeks. Full PMS: don't attempt.
- **LTD Fit**: Moderate — dental practices have high revenue ($500K-$2M+/year), less price-sensitive. Focused add-on at $299-$599 LTD works.
- **Content Strategy**: Target "Dentrix alternative 2026", "AI dental software", "dental insurance verification software", "dental practice automation", "best dental software for new practice".

## 8. Construction Tech — $270M CapitalG Round Signals Massive Institutional Interest

- **Category**: Trades Digital / Legacy Disruption
- **Signal Strength**: Strong (Fresh Signal)
- **Sources**:
  - [Alphabet's CapitalG Leads $270M Round in US Construction Tech — StartupNews](https://startupnews.fyi/2026/02/05/capitalg-270m-construction-tech-funding/)

  - [6 ConTech Startups Net $124.5M in Q4 2025 — Construction Dive](https://www.constructiondive.com/news/construction-tech-funding-Q4-2025/808986/)
  - [10 Fastest Growing Construction Tech Companies — Landbase](https://www.landbase.com/blog/fastest-growing-construction-tech-companies)
  - [Construction Startups Funded by YC 2026 — Y Combinator](https://www.ycombinator.com/companies/industry/construction)

- **Description**: AI-based ConTech funding hit $521M in Q1 2026 — the highest since 2021. Alphabet's CapitalG led a $270M round in a US-based construction tech firm in Feb 2026, the largest single round in the sector this year. 6 ConTech startups netted $124.5M in Q4 2025 alone. 90% of surveyed investors plan to increase or maintain ConTech investments in 2026. Despite being one of the world's largest industries, construction has historically lagged in software adoption — projects remain fragmented across contractors, subcontractors, suppliers, and regulators with limited real-time visibility. Construction management software is projected to reach $16.62B by 2030. **The opportunity for boring business builders**: construction is too complex for a full platform play, but specific workflow tools — subcontractor payment tracking, daily log digitization, safety compliance checklists, material procurement comparison — are viable as standalone products.
- **Target Industries**: General contractors, subcontractors, specialty trades (concrete, framing, drywall, painting), construction managers, residential builders, commercial developers
- **Market Timing**: Growing — institutional capital flowing in. Individual workflow tools still have greenfield opportunity.
- **Example Products**:
  - [Procore](https://www.procore.com/) — #1 construction management platform
  - [Fieldwire](https://www.fieldwire.com/) — Field management for job sites
  - [Buildertrend](https://www.buildertrend.com/) — Residential construction management
  - [CoConstruct](https://www.coconstruct.com/) — Custom home builder software
  - [Ladder](https://www.ladderteams.com/) — Construction trades recruiting
- **White Space**: (1) Subcontractor payment tracking — "did the GC pay the sub?" transparency tool for small subs. (2) Daily construction log app with photo documentation that auto-generates progress reports. (3) Material procurement price comparison across local suppliers. (4) Simple lien waiver management and tracking. (5) Construction crew time tracking with GPS verification and job costing.
- **Speed to Market**: Daily log app: 2-3 weeks. Payment tracking: 3-4 weeks. Safety checklist tool: 2 weeks.
- **LTD Fit**: Strong for focused tools — subcontractors are price-sensitive. $149-$299 LTD for a payment tracker or daily log app.
- **Content Strategy**: Target "subcontractor payment tracking", "construction daily log app", "construction safety checklist app", "lien waiver tracking software". Low competition for specific workflow tools.

- **Category**: Vertical SaaS / Mobile-First Field Tools
- **Signal Strength**: Moderate
- **Sources**:
  - [Best Cleaning Service Software 2026 — Workyard](https://www.workyard.com/compare/cleaning-service-software)

  - [7 Best Janitorial Software Compared 2026 — BuildBite](https://buildbite.com/insights/best-janitorial-software)
  - [Cleaning Services Software Reviews — G2](https://www.g2.com/categories/cleaning-services)
  - [Zapium — Commercial Cleaning Business Software](https://www.zapium.com/software/field-service-management/cleaning-business/)
- **Description**: Most janitorial businesses fall into a gap: too complex for spreadsheets but not ready for enterprise-level software. Generic field service tools lack intuitive crew coordination or come loaded with unnecessary features. The market splits: ZenMaid dominates residential cleaning ($1M+ ARR, focused exclusively on maid services), Swept targets commercial janitorial, Aspire serves $3M+ revenue enterprises, and generic tools (Jobber, Housecall Pro) handle the middle. **The underserved segment**: commercial cleaning companies with $500K-$3M revenue and 10-50 crew members. They need real-time mobile notifications, GPS verification of arrival, photo documentation tied to tasks, and client portal access — but at a price point below Aspire. Key features emerging in 2026: AI-powered quality inspection (photo comparison before/after), automated crew scheduling based on building requirements and crew certifications, and client-facing dashboards showing cleaning completion verification.
- **Target Industries**: Residential cleaning, commercial janitorial, office cleaning, post-construction cleaning, carpet cleaning, window cleaning, pressure washing
- **Market Timing**: Growing — ZenMaid proved the niche model works. Commercial mid-market gap remains.
- **Example Products**:
  - [ZenMaid](https://www.zenmaid.com/) — Residential cleaning, $1M+ ARR
  - [Swept](https://sweptworks.com/) — Commercial janitorial
  - [GorillaDesk](https://gorilladesk.com/) — Pest, lawn, cleaning
  - [Aspire](https://www.youraspire.com/) — Enterprise cleaning ($3M+ revenue)
  - [CleanTelligent](https://www.cleantelligent.com/) — Quality management for janitorial
- **White Space**: (1) AI quality verification — before/after photo comparison with automatic deficiency flagging. (2) Cleaning crew scheduling optimizer that accounts for building requirements, crew certifications, and drive time. (3) Client-facing cleaning verification portal — real-time proof of service completion. (4) Cleaning supply inventory management with auto-reordering.
- **Speed to Market**: Cleaning verification portal (photo proof of service): 2-3 weeks. Full cleaning management: 4-5 weeks.
- **LTD Fit**: Strong — cleaning business owners are cost-conscious. $99-$199 LTD for focused tool.
- **Content Strategy**: Target "cleaning business software", "janitorial management app", "cleaning company scheduling software", "commercial cleaning bidding software".

## 10. Mobile-First Deskless Workforce Management — 80% of Workers Still Underserved

- **Category**: Mobile-First Field Tools / SMB Platform Consolidation
- **Signal Strength**: Moderate
- **Sources**:
  - [The Rise of The Mobile Workforce and Deskless Workers — Skedulo](https://www.skedulo.com/the-rise-of-the-mobile-workforce-and-deskless-workers/)
  - [Best Mobile Workforce Management Software 2026 — Workever](https://workever.com/blog/best-mobile-workforce-management-software/)
  - [The Full Guide to Mobile Workforce Management 2026 — Connecteam](https://connecteam.com/mobile-workforce-management-app-management-just-got-easy/)
  - [Tech Trends in Mobile Workforce Management — Labor Sync](https://www.laborsync.com/blog/tech-trends-mobile-workforce)
  - [9 Workforce Management Solutions 2026 — Playroll](https://www.playroll.com/blog/workforce-management-solutions)
  - [Top 10 Mobile Workforce Management Software — theEMPLOYEEapp](https://theemployeeapp.com/blog/best-mobile-workforce-management-software/)
- **Description**: 80% of the global workforce is deskless, yet most software is built for desk workers. The mobile workforce management market is growing at 13.2% CAGR (2024-2033). Companies with mobile self-service options report 34% higher retention among younger workers. **The trend in 2026**: workforce management platforms are adding wellness tracking, feedback loops, and engagement features — not just scheduling and time tracking. Connecteam leads the mobile-first segment for deskless teams with scheduling, time tracking, task management, communication, and training in one app. But Connecteam is still horizontal. The opportunity: trade-specific mobile workforce tools that combine scheduling + time tracking + trade-specific workflows (safety checklists, equipment inspections, certification tracking) in one phone-first experience. The key insight: deskless workers interact with software on phones in the field, often with gloves on, in poor lighting, with spotty connectivity. The UX requirements are radically different from desk software.
- **Target Industries**: All field-based boring businesses — trades, cleaning, landscaping, construction, delivery, pest control, property maintenance
- **Market Timing**: Growing — horizontal solutions exist but trade-specific mobile workforce tools are rare.
- **Example Products**:
  - [Connecteam](https://connecteam.com/) — All-in-one for deskless teams
  - [Skedulo](https://www.skedulo.com/) — Deskless productivity cloud
  - [Workever](https://workever.com/) — Mobile workforce management
  - [Labor Sync](https://www.laborsync.com/) — Field workforce tracking
- **White Space**: (1) Trade-specific mobile app: "Electrician's Workday" — clock in, see today's jobs, safety checklist, photo documentation, time per task, all from phone with large touch targets and offline mode. (2) Crew communication + task management that works offline for rural/no-signal job sites. (3) Certification/license expiry tracking for trades workers across multiple crew members. (4) Mobile-first training/onboarding for new trades hires — video-based, completable on phone between jobs.
- **Speed to Market**: Focused mobile workforce app for one trade: 3-4 weeks. Certification tracking tool: 2 weeks.
- **LTD Fit**: Moderate — per-worker economics may suit monthly pricing better for larger crews. LTD works for small crews (1-5 workers) at $149-$249.
- **Content Strategy**: Target "[trade] crew management app", "field worker time tracking", "deskless workforce software", "mobile scheduling for [trade]".

- **Signal Strength**: Moderate

- **Description**: Franchise management software market: $10.46B by 2031 (15.4% CAGR). FranConnect dominates enterprise (1,500+ brands, 1M+ locations), with customers growing at 5.5% annually — nearly double the 2.6% industry average. But FranConnect and BrandWide are expensive and complex for 5-25 location operators. Manual processes break at the 10-unit threshold, creating acute software need at exactly the growth inflection point. The graduated approach: startup phase (1-3 locations) needs basic scheduling and POS; growth phase (4-15 locations) needs standardized operations and performance tracking; scaling phase (30+) needs $1,000+/month investment. **The gap**: tools for the 5-25 location "awkward middle" — too big for spreadsheets, too small for FranConnect.
- **Target Industries**: Home services franchises (cleaning, restoration, pest control), food service, fitness studios, automotive services, salons, tutoring centers
- **Market Timing**: Growing — franchise model booming in boring businesses, software hasn't caught up for small operators.

  - [Connecteam](https://connecteam.com/) — Mobile-first distributed workforce
  - [Operandio](https://operandio.com/) — Franchise compliance & ops
- **White Space**: (1) Lightweight "franchise-in-a-box" for 5-25 locations ($99-$199/mo per location). (2) Multi-location reputation management — Google profiles, review responses, local SEO from one dashboard. (3) Franchisee performance benchmarking with anonymous industry comparisons. (4) Franchise launch toolkit — ops playbooks + templates + compliance checklists.
- **Speed to Market**: Multi-location reputation dashboard: 3-4 weeks. Full franchise management: too complex for MVP.
- **LTD Fit**: Weak for full franchise tools (per-location economics). Moderate for focused reputation tool at $299-$499 LTD.
- **Content Strategy**: Target "how to franchise a [business type]", "[business type] franchise software", "manage multiple Google Business profiles".

## 12. E-Invoicing & Compliance — Regulatory Deadlines Creating Forced Adoption

- **Category**: Compliance & Regulation Tech / Paper-to-Digital
- **Signal Strength**: Moderate
- **Sources**:
  - [Key Compliance Framework Changes 2026 — ScalePad](https://www.scalepad.com/blog/from-awareness-to-assurance-key-compliance-framework-changes-coming-in-2026/)
  - [Top 10 Compliance Challenges 2026 — Skillcast](https://www.skillcast.com/blog/top-10-compliance-challenges-2026)
  - [2026 Regulatory Issues — Paychex](https://www.paychex.com/articles/compliance/top-regulatory-issues)
  - [2026 European Digital Regulatory Developments — Data Advisor](https://www.wsgrdataadvisor.com/2026/01/2026-year-in-preview-european-digital-regulatory-developments-for-companies-to-watch-out-for/)
  - [Your 2026 Digital Compliance Playbook — VinciWorks](https://vinciworks.com/blog/your-2026-digital-compliance-playbook-what-are-the-key-laws-affecting-cyber-security-and-data-protection/)
  - [Top 11 Regulatory Compliance Software 2026 — Zluri](https://www.zluri.com/blog/regulatory-compliance-software)
- **Description**: Multiple compliance deadlines converging in 2026 force boring businesses toward digital tools: UK Making Tax Digital mandates quarterly digital reporting from April 2026 for sole traders/landlords earning £50K+. Germany's e-invoicing mandate is live. EU AI Act enters full enforcement August 2026. CCPA amendments on automated decision-making: Jan 1, 2026. Colorado AI Act: June 30, 2026. Multiple new state-level AI regulations across CA, CO, IL, ME, TX, UT. CCPA compliance alone could impose ~$16K/year on small businesses. Global e-invoicing market: ~$20.5B by 2026 (20.4% CAGR). **The boring business angle**: most compliance tools target enterprise/tech companies. Trades and local services are ignored. A plumber in the UK now needs digital tax submission tools. A cleaning company in Colorado needs to understand AI compliance if they use AI scheduling. The opportunity is compliance made dead-simple for non-tech business owners.
- **Target Industries**: All trades, landlords/property managers, sole traders, any SMB doing invoicing or employing workers
- **Market Timing**: Growing — regulatory deadlines creating urgency. Most SMBs are unaware of changes.
- **Example Products**:
  - [Xero](https://www.xero.com/) — Cloud accounting for SMBs
  - [QuickBooks](https://quickbooks.intuit.com/) — Dominant SMB accounting
  - [FreshBooks](https://www.freshbooks.com/) — Invoicing for freelancers/trades
  - [SafetyCulture](https://safetyculture.com/) — Safety inspections and checklists
- **White Space**: (1) Compliance-first invoicing for trades — auto-handle tax categorization, MTD submission (UK), e-invoicing formatting. (2) "Compliance dashboard for contractors" — input state + trade + team size → automated checklist of licenses, certifications, deadlines. (3) OSHA toolbox talk libraries for specific trades as mobile app with sign-off tracking. (4) Safety documentation generators for job hazard analyses.
- **Speed to Market**: Compliance checklist generator for one state + one trade: 2-3 weeks. Invoicing + MTD compliance: 2-4 weeks.
- **LTD Fit**: Strong — business owners will pay $99-$199 once to "stop worrying about compliance." Fear-of-fines drives conversion.
- **Content Strategy**: Target "Making Tax Digital for [trade]", "OSHA requirements for [trade]", "contractor license requirements [state]", "small business compliance 2026".

## Market-Level Context

### Key Statistics
- **Home services market (US)**: $600B+, growing at 14.4% CAGR
- **Auto repair & maintenance (US)**: $800B projected by 2026
- **Global FSM market**: $5.64B (2025) → $9.68B (2030)
- **Global vertical SaaS market**: $94.86B current → $720.44B by 2028 (25.89% CAGR)
- **AI in dental market**: $459.6M (2024) → $3.26B (2034), 21.78% CAGR
- **Property management software**: $5.88B (2024) → $12.56B by 2033, 8.8% CAGR
- **RV storage market**: $48B (2022) → $80B by 2035
- **Construction management software**: Projected to reach $16.62B by 2030
- **AI-based ConTech funding**: $521M in Q1 2026 — highest since 2021
- **Franchise management software**: $10.46B by 2031, 15.4% CAGR
- **Mobile workforce management**: 13.2% CAGR (2024-2033)
- **Lawn care software market**: Projected to $2.5B by 2033, 9.5% CAGR
- **Global micro-SaaS segment**: $15.7B (2024) → $59.6B by 2030, ~30% annual growth
- **SaaS total industry**: On track for $375B in 2026
- **Vertical SaaS VC funding Jan 2026**: $119M (collapsed 94% from $2.04B in Jan 2025)
- **Total vertical SaaS funding 2026 YTD**: $134M across all rounds
- **Shopmonkey (auto repair)**: $110M raised, $45M ARR, only 2.6% of 230K US shops

### Macro Signals
- **Vertical > horizontal**: Industry-specific tools growing 2-3x faster than general productivity (~32% vs. ~12% annually)
- **AI commoditization in trades**: AI receptionists becoming table-stakes FSM feature; standalone AI tools must go deeper
- **VC funding collapse for vertical SaaS without AI**: 94% drop signals less VC-funded competition for bootstrapped builders — but your product needs AI to have fundraising optionality
- **Construction tech resurgence**: CapitalG $270M round + $521M AI ConTech funding in Q1 2026 signals institutional conviction
- **Auto repair is the next home services**: 97%+ shops still on legacy/paper at 2.6% cloud penetration — mirrors HVAC/plumbing 5 years ago
- **Niche property types underserved**: Self-storage, RV parks, marinas, campgrounds identified as most ripe for proptech disruption
- **Deskless worker gap**: 80% of global workforce is deskless, yet most software is built for desk workers
- **Paper-to-digital gap persists**: Only 17% of small firms use automated AR. Plumbing businesses losing 15-25% of revenue to scheduling inefficiencies
- **Profitability over growth**: 70%+ profit margins for bootstrapped micro-SaaS. Solo founders hitting $5K-$50K+ MRR
- **Regulatory forcing functions**: UK MTD (April 2026), EU AI Act (August 2026), CCPA/Colorado AI Act, OSHA changes — all pushing SMBs toward digital tools
- **34% higher retention** for companies with mobile self-service options among younger deskless workers

### Meta-Trend Summary

| Trend | Signal | Timing | LTD Fit | Speed |
|-------|--------|--------|---------|-------|
| AI Agents for Trades (Platform Bundling) | Strong | Growing (commoditizing) | Moderate | 2-3 wks |

### Top 3 Opportunities for Fast LTD Launch

1. **Auto Repair DVI (Digital Vehicle Inspection) App** — Standalone photo-based inspection tool that works without full shop management. Snap photos of wear/damage, annotate, send branded report to customer for repair approval. 230K US shops, 97%+ on legacy tools. Ship in 2-3 weeks. LTD at $149-$249. YouTube demos of photo inspection workflows convert well. Low competition — Shopmonkey/Tekmetric are full platforms, not focused DVI tools.

2. **Trade-Specific AI Estimating Tool** — Photo-based quoting for one trade (painting, pressure washing, fencing). Snap photo + select options = instant branded estimate → invoice → payment. Category is forming NOW with multiple funded products but no dominant player. Ship in 3-4 weeks. LTD at $199-$399.

3. **Marina/RV Park Operations App** — Niche property management for non-traditional properties (marinas, RV parks, campgrounds). Slip/site assignments + billing + maintenance + tenant communication. Explicitly called out as "most ripe for disruption" by Commercial Observer. Low competition, fragmented market. Ship in 3-4 weeks. LTD at $199-$399.

### Key Shifts from Yesterday (2/24)

1. **Auto repair identified as a new "next wave" opportunity**. The parallels to home services digitization 5 years ago are striking: massive market ($800B), extremely low cloud penetration (2.6%), legacy incumbents (Mitchell 1), and well-funded challengers (Shopmonkey $110M, Tekmetric + Shopgenie merger). This is an under-discussed boring business vertical compared to HVAC/plumbing.

2. **Niche property types (marinas, RV parks, campgrounds) surfaced as an explicit disruption target**. Commercial Observer specifically named these as the most ripe proptech sectors — they run on manual, fragmented systems. The RV storage market alone is $48B heading to $80B. Software for these niches is reservation-focused, leaving operations automation wide open.

3. **Construction tech funding surging with institutional backing**. CapitalG's $270M round and $521M in AI ConTech funding in Q1 2026 (highest since 2021) signal that construction digitization is entering a new phase. For indie builders, the opportunity is in focused workflow tools (daily logs, payment tracking, safety checklists) rather than competing with Procore.
